title: Esther Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Esther with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 10 chapters.

questions.question: Who was the king reigning over the hundred and seven and twenty provinces from India to Ethiopia?
questions.explanation: King Ahasuerus reigned over the vast Persian empire stretching from India to Ethiopia.

questions.question: Where was the throne of King Ahasuerus located?
questions.explanation: The king sat on the throne of his kingdom in Shushan the palace.

questions.question: How long did the initial feast made by King Ahasuerus, showing the riches of his kingdom, last?
questions.explanation: The king showed the riches and honor of his kingdom for one hundred and fourscore (180) days.

questions.question: What was the consequence for Queen Vashti when she refused the king's command to appear before him?
options: She was removed as queen and her royal estate was given to another
questions.correctAnswer: She was removed as queen and her royal estate was given to another
questions.explanation: Because Vashti disobeyed the king's command, he decreed she would no longer come before him and gave her estate to another.

questions.question: Who advised King Ahasuerus regarding the punishment of Queen Vashti?
questions.explanation: Memucan, one of the seven princes, gave counsel about Vashti's disobedience.

questions.question: What was the king's decree concerning the authority of husbands over their wives after Vashti's removal?
options: Every man should rule in his own house and every wife should honor her husband
Women were granted equal rights with men
Men and women were to share authority equally
Wives were to govern the household
questions.correctAnswer: Every man should rule in his own house and every wife should honor her husband
questions.explanation: The decree established that every man should bear rule in his own house and wives should give honor to their husbands.

questions.question: What was the Jewish young woman's Persian name given after she was taken to the king's palace?
questions.explanation: Hadassah was her Hebrew name; she was called Esther in the king's palace.

questions.question: Who was Mordecai in relation to Esther?
questions.explanation: Mordecai was Esther's cousin who had taken her as his own daughter after her parents died.

questions.question: Why did Mordecai refuse to bow to Haman?
options: Because Mordecai was a Jew and would not bow to Haman who was an Agagite
Because he was forbidden by the king
Because Haman was not of noble birth
questions.correctAnswer: Because Mordecai was a Jew and would not bow to Haman who was an Agagite
questions.explanation: Mordecai refused to bow or show reverence to Haman, as he was a Jew and Haman an enemy.

questions.question: What lot (Pur) did Haman cast to determine the day to destroy the Jews?
options: The thirteenth day of the twelfth month (Adar)
questions.correctAnswer: The thirteenth day of the twelfth month (Adar)
questions.explanation: Haman cast lots to choose the date to exterminate the Jews, which fell on Adar 13.

questions.question: What did Haman offer King Ahasuerus in exchange for permission to destroy the Jews?
questions.explanation: Haman offered to pay ten thousand talents of silver to the king's treasuries for the Jews' destruction.

questions.question: How did King Ahasuerus seal the decree allowing the destruction of the Jews?
options: By the command of his princes
questions.explanation: The king took off his signet ring and gave it to Haman, sealing the decree.

questions.question: Where was the decree for the Jews' destruction sent out from?
questions.explanation: The letters were sent out from Shushan the palace as per the king's command.

questions.question: How did Esther respond when she was first taken to the king's palace?
options: She obeyed Mordecai's instructions and did not reveal her nationality
She openly declared she was a Jew
questions.correctAnswer: She obeyed Mordecai's instructions and did not reveal her nationality
questions.explanation: Esther kept her Jewish identity secret as Mordecai had instructed.

questions.question: What was the king's reaction when he first saw Esther standing in the court?
options: He held out the golden sceptre, showing favor
He was angry she came unbidden
questions.correctAnswer: He held out the golden sceptre, showing favor
questions.explanation: The king extended the golden sceptre to Esther, signifying she had found favor.

questions.question: What did Esther request of the king at her first banquet invitation?
options: That the king and Haman come to a banquet she prepared
That Haman be appointed prime minister
That she be given the kingdom
That the Jews be spared immediately
questions.correctAnswer: That the king and Haman come to a banquet she prepared
questions.explanation: Esther asked the king to invite Haman to a banquet she had prepared.

questions.question: What did Haman do when he saw Mordecai refusing to bow to him?
options: He was full of wrath and indignation
He reported Mordecai to the king immediately
questions.correctAnswer: He was full of wrath and indignation
questions.explanation: Haman was filled with fury when Mordecai would not bow to him.

questions.question: What did Haman's wife Zeresh and his friends advise him to do about Mordecai?
options: Build a gallows fifty cubits high to hang Mordecai
To ask the king for permission to punish Mordecai
questions.correctAnswer: Build a gallows fifty cubits high to hang Mordecai
questions.explanation: They advised Haman to erect a gallows and hang Mordecai on it.

questions.question: How did King Ahasuerus react when Esther revealed Haman's plot against her people?
options: He was enraged and ordered Haman to be hanged on the gallows he prepared
questions.correctAnswer: He was enraged and ordered Haman to be hanged on the gallows he prepared
questions.explanation: The king's wrath was kindled, and he commanded that Haman be hanged on the gallows.

questions.question: What was Esther's request to King Ahasuerus during her second banquet?
options: That her life and the lives of her people be spared
That Haman be made prime minister
That she be given the kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: That her life and the lives of her people be spared
questions.explanation: Esther pleaded for her life and her people, who were marked for destruction.

questions.question: Who was the king's chamberlain who revealed the gallows to the king?
questions.explanation: Harbonah was the chamberlain who told the king about the gallows Haman had built.

questions.question: What position was Mordecai promoted to after Haman's death?
questions.explanation: Mordecai was made second in rank to the king.

questions.question: What was the name of the month in which the Jews were to be destroyed according to Haman's decree?
questions.explanation: The twelfth month, Adar, was the appointed month for the destruction.

questions.question: What was the main theme demonstrated by the story of Esther?
options: Divine providence and deliverance of God's people
questions.correctAnswer: Divine providence and deliverance of God's people
questions.explanation: The book shows how God’s providence saves the Jews through Esther and Mordecai.

questions.question: Who was Haman's wife?
questions.explanation: Zeresh was Haman's wife who advised him to build the gallows.

questions.question: What did Mordecai do when he learned of the decree against the Jews?
options: He tore his clothes, put on sackcloth and ashes, and mourned openly
He wrote a letter to the king
questions.correctAnswer: He tore his clothes, put on sackcloth and ashes, and mourned openly
questions.explanation: Mordecai mourned with sackcloth and ashes at the king's gate.

questions.question: Who advised Esther to approach the king despite the risk to her life?
questions.explanation: Mordecai urged Esther to intercede with the king for her people.

questions.question: What phrase did Mordecai use to describe the possible consequences if Esther remained silent?
options: Relief and deliverance will arise to the Jews from another place
The people will perish without hope
questions.correctAnswer: Relief and deliverance will arise to the Jews from another place
questions.explanation: Mordecai told Esther that deliverance would come from elsewhere if she stayed silent.

questions.question: What was Esther's plan after gaining the king's favor?
options: To invite the king and Haman to two banquets
To write a letter to the people
questions.correctAnswer: To invite the king and Haman to two banquets
questions.explanation: Esther prepared two banquets to reveal Haman's plot.

questions.question: What did the king do after Haman fell on the couch where Esther was reclining?
options: He ordered Haman’s face to be covered and then to be hanged
questions.correctAnswer: He ordered Haman’s face to be covered and then to be hanged
questions.explanation: The king thought Haman was assaulting the queen and ordered his execution.

questions.question: What did Esther say she and her people were sold to be?
questions.explanation: Esther revealed that she and her people were sold for destruction and death.

questions.question: How did the king confirm the greatness of Mordecai after Haman's death?
options: By laying a tribute upon the land and advancing Mordecai
questions.correctAnswer: By laying a tribute upon the land and advancing Mordecai
questions.explanation: The king laid tribute and advanced Mordecai, who was next to him in power.

questions.question: True or False: Vashti obeyed the king's command to appear before him wearing the crown royal.
questions.explanation: Vashti refused to come at the king's command, which angered him.

questions.question: True or False: Mordecai was rewarded by the king for revealing a plot to assassinate him.
questions.explanation: Mordecai exposed a conspiracy, and his deed was recorded in the king's chronicles.

questions.question: True or False: Haman was promoted to the highest position among the king's princes.
questions.explanation: Haman was promoted above all princes and servants of the king.

questions.question: True or False: Esther revealed her Jewish identity to the king immediately after becoming queen.
questions.explanation: Esther kept her Jewish nationality secret as Mordecai instructed.

questions.question: True or False: The king gave Haman his signet ring to authorize the destruction of the Jews.
questions.explanation: The king gave Haman his ring, sealing the decree against the Jews.

questions.question: True or False: Esther invited only the king to the banquet she prepared on the first day.
questions.explanation: Esther invited both the king and Haman to the banquet.

questions.question: True or False: Haman built gallows to hang Mordecai before revealing his plot to the king.
questions.explanation: Haman built a gallows fifty cubits high to hang Mordecai.

questions.question: True or False: Esther risked her life by entering the king's presence unsummoned.
questions.explanation: Approaching the king unsummoned could lead to death, yet Esther did so.

questions.question: True or False: The king was unaware of Haman's plot against the Jews until Esther revealed it.
questions.explanation: The king only learned of the plot during Esther's banquet.

questions.question: True or False: Haman was hanged on the gallows he had prepared for Mordecai.
questions.explanation: Haman was executed on the very gallows he built for Mordecai.

questions.question: True or False: Mordecai was accepted and honored by the multitude of the Jews after the events.
questions.explanation: Mordecai became great and accepted among the Jews.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "For if thou altogether holdest thy peace at this time, then shall there enlargement and deliverance arise to the Jews from _________."
questions.explanation: Mordecai assured Esther that deliverance would come from another place if she remained silent.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "And the king said unto Esther the queen, What is thy petition? and it shall be granted thee: and what is thy request? even to the half of the _______ it shall be performed."
questions.explanation: The king promised Esther that her request would be granted even to half the kingdom.
